description.narrative: Communities affected by Super Typhoon Rolly will be the primary beneficiaries of this project. A criterion shall be formulated by the dioceses to guide them in selecting the beneficiaries and community participation shall be encouraged. The following are some criteria guides that shall be established in the selection of beneficiaries for the interventions that will be provided. Keeping in mind that aside from the criteria listed below, the following also are some considerations in the selection: a) existing capacities of the partner dioceses and cooperation/willingness of the selected communities to participate in the project, and b) status of the underserved areas, and close coordination with the various stakeholders and agencies basing from the updated 3Ws.

The overall goal is to meet the essential emergency needs: shelter, livelihoods and enhanced emergency preparedness capacity of 1,780 households (9,750 individuals), affected by Super Typhoon Goni (local name: Rolly) in the provinces of Catanduanes and Albay, Philippines
Specific Objectives:
1. To ensure access of 800 most affected households (4,000 individuals) in 2 dioceses (Albay and Catanduanes) to essential shelter
2. To ensure access of 980 most vulnerable households (4,900 individuals + 850 staff and volunteers) in Catanduanes to alternative livelihoods and enhanced emergency preparedness and other capacity building activities within one year
Cordaid funds 9% of the EA budget

Typhoon Goni made its first landfall in Bato, Catanduanes on the 1st of November, 2020. According to the accounts of the residents in the ground zero, typhoon Goni was the strongest they have been experienced in the past 26 years.
Four days after the super typhoon devastated six of the 11 municipalities in Catanduanes, NASSA/Caritas Philippines’ emergency team was deployed to conduct rapid assessment and assist Caritas Virac in establishing its emergency operations center.
